6024.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَا أُقْسِمُ بِهَٰذَا الْبَلَدِ
6024.verse-english: I swear by this city, Makkah -

clauses-english.clause: I swear by this city,
Makkah -

6025.verse-english: And you, [O Muhammad], are free of restriction in this city -

clauses-english.clause: And you,
[O Muhammad],
are free of restriction in this city -

6026.verse-english: And [by] the father and that which was born [of him],

clauses-english.clause: And [by] the father and that which was born [of him],

6027.verse-english: We have certainly created man into hardship.

clauses-english.clause: We have certainly created man into hardship.

6028.verse-arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
6028.verse-english: Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?

clauses-arabic.clause: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ

clauses-english.clause: Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?

6029.verse-english: He says, "I have spent wealth in abundance."

clauses-english.clause: He says,
"I have spent wealth in abundance.

6030.verse-english: Does he think that no one has seen him?

clauses-english.clause: Does he think that no one has seen him?

6031.verse-english: Have We not made for him two eyes?

clauses-english.clause: Have We not made for him two eyes?

6032.verse-english: And a tongue and two lips?

clauses-english.clause: And a tongue and two lips?

6033.verse-english: And have shown him the two ways?

clauses-english.clause: And have shown him the two ways?

6034.verse-english: But he has not broken through the difficult pass.

clauses-english.clause: But he has not broken through the difficult pass.

6035.verse-english: And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?

clauses-english.clause: And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?

6036.verse-english: It is the freeing of a slave

clauses-english.clause: It is the freeing of a slave

6037.verse-arabic: أَوْ إِطْعَامٌ فِي يَوْمٍ ذِي مَسْغَبَةٍ
6037.verse-english: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger

clauses-arabic.clause: أَوْ إِطْعَامٌ فِي يَوْمٍ ذِي مَسْغَبَةٍ

clauses-english.clause: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger
An orphan of near relationship

6039.verse-english: Or a needy person in misery

clauses-english.clause: Or a needy person in misery

6040.verse-arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْمَرْحَمَةِ
6040.verse-english: And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.

clauses-arabic.clause: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْمَرْحَمَةِ

clauses-english.clause: And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.

6041.verse-english: Those are the companions of the right.

clauses-english.clause: Those are the companions of the right.

6042.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ
6042.verse-english: But they who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.

clauses-english.clause: But they who disbelieved in Our signs -
those are the companions of the left.

6043.verse-english: Over them will be fire closed in.

clauses-english.clause: Over them will be fire closed in.
